reviews.text: I find that whisking the sugar with the warm melted butter gives me the fudgiest brownies. Don't overdo it though, just until the sugar disappears. Then adding the eggs, also it's better to do it with a wooden spoon and not a whisk. This way you avoid overbeating the eggs. But this is just my way. It doesn't mean others are not also good.

aspects.mention: whisking the sugar with the warm melted butter gives me the fudgiest brownies
Don't overdo it though, just until the sugar disappears
adding the eggs, also it's better to do it with a wooden spoon and not a whisk
it doesn't mean others are not also good

reviews.text:
Recipe

1 cup or grams butter
1/3 cup or 75 grams cocoa powder 
2 cups or 400 grams granulated sugar
1 tsp instant espresso (optional)
3 large eggs
1 tbsp or 15 mL vanilla essence
1 tsp salt
1 and 1/2 cup or 270 grams dark/milk/semi-sweet chocolate OR using the same measurement, chocolate chips can also be used
1 cup flour

aspects.mention: 1 cup or grams butter, 75 grams cocoa powder, etc.

reviews.text:
Thank you so much for the great recipe! This is for a class project, however, I wanted to advocate for the deaf community and let you know that having closed captions can be extremely helpful when it comes to watching videos, as they can allow for the viewer to better understand what is being said whenever a word is not understood by the automated captions. 
I love your videos and I'm sure that many people in the deaf community also, as your recipes are extremely delicious (have tested and tasted many of them). Have a great day and thank you for reading my comment :)

aspects.mention: Thank you so much for the great recipe
your recipes are extremely delicious (have tested and tasted many of them)

reviews.text: This is really a smart video. for anyone who's curious, there are alternatives to chocolate out there and one of them is carob. carob is basically, diet chocolate, it doesn't have any of the texture chocolate does and will make anything it's added to taste bad, because it's basically edible chalk, in that it's naturally salty and has no value as a nutritional item. also it's naturally oily and will cause problems if not handled properly. unless you are allergic to chocolate, avoid carob.

aspects.mention: there are alternatives to chocolate out there and one of them is carob
carob doesn't have any of the texture chocolate does and will make anything it's added to taste bad

reviews.text:
Oven to 350

Cube 1 cup or 226 g of butter
Melt butter and stir in between 
Add 3/4 cup or 75g of cocoa powder 
2 cups or 400g granulated sugar
1tsp of instant expresso powder (optional) 
Sift
Whisk vigorously for crackly top
3 large room temp eggs
1tbsp of vanilla
1tsp salt
Whisk again
Make sure it‚Äôs not that grainy
Chocolate bar, 270 g or 1 and 1/2 cup
120 g or leveled 1 cup all purpose flour 
Mix until flour is just incorporated 
Transfer batter into pan 
Bake for 35-40ish mins for fudgy or cakes brownie

aspects.mention: Detailed step-by-step instructions provided

reviews.text: Just baked these and they're in the oven. NOW I realise I used drinking chocolate powder instead of cocoa powder......aagh! The tins looked almost alike. I await in trepidation...... Okay, I'm back. They were only in for 30 mins but were really smelling exactly what they were....burnt around the edges. When it cools my husband and I will sample the centre and see if it's redeemable. I think the extra sugar in the drinking chocolate powder skewed everything badly. I will try your gorgeous recipe, the right way, when I've recovered from the trauma.

aspects.mention: used drinking chocolate powder instead of cocoa powder
smelling exactly what they were....burnt around the edges

226g melted butter 
75g coco powder 
300g sugar 
3 large eggs
1tbsp vanilla extract
1tsp salt
1 cup plain white flour

reviews.text:
Can you use olive oil instead of butter?

Update: you can if you use warm oil, and if you add another cup of flour, up to a half cup of milk, and use aluminum foil in a bread pan. They're still a little fudgy but they're also really soft and almost like air they melt in your mouth so fast and you're still left with a full feeling and chocolatey taste.

You can also choose not to add the chocolate chunks. It's really delicious. I made like 5-6 different batches and variations of this recipe.

BUT WHATEVER YOU DO AT LEAST USE ALUMINUM FOIL!

if you try just using butter or oil to coat the pan, it will cause the outside crust to sort of caramelize and it may end up sticking to the pan.

aspects.mention: Can you use olive oil instead of butter?
made like 5-6 different batches and variations

reviews.text:
7/10 I baked my first brownies with this recipe. First of all, SO FUDGY, CHOCOLATE-TY AND CHEWY. But I am not a fan of chocolate, and so is my family. I just thought it would be fun to bake as it looked easy and it was! ONE THING I DONT LIKE, it was WAYY TOO SWEET [according to my parents] but for me it was not that bad, i guess? Maybe because I have a sweet tooth. My dad said its insane to put that much sugar I'll definitely bake these next time but less sugar. My whole packet of sugar literally is gone now because too much sugar, i had to mix it with castor sugar that I had because i ran out of granulated.

The brownies reached my expectations. Crinkly, fudgy, chewy and on the inside is gooey with chocolate melts. Highly recommend.

aspects.mention: SO FUDGY, CHOCOLATE-TY AND CHEWY
WAYY TOO SWEET [according to my parents]
Highly recommend

reviews.text: I made these (using your previous video) last weekend, and added in a scoop of Vegemite and omitted the salt and coffee, and used a bit less chocolate. Idk if you're familiar with Vegemite or Marmite, but it's a yeast extract that brings an incredible umami flavour and goes beautifully with 70% dark chocolate. So, so good - the only thing was I lost the smooth crackly top that I got when I followed your recipe precisely, so I'm going to have to experiment again with the quantities.

aspects.mention: added in a scoop of Vegemite and omitted the salt and coffee
brings an incredible umami flavour

reviews.text:
Update: I made the fudgiest brownies using a Betty Crocker recipe from the 70s. It was the first time I didn't make cake. I mixed the shortening and chocolate and sugar in my KA added the eggs and whipped. Measured the flour keeping it fluffy, then folded the flour until just enough. WHAT A DIFFERENCE.

That said, from someone who hates coffee, espresso powder absolutely makes things taste like coffee to non coffee drinkers. Those brownies have been ruined.

I love your show and came on here for tips before I bake brownies tonight in my tiny kitchen.

aspects.mention: espresso powder absolutely makes things taste like coffee to non coffee drinkers
I love your show
